text: You throw off the covers, swing your legs out of bed, stand up fast because you're already running late. You shuffle to the kitchen. First thing? Coffee. Strong. Black. Before you've had a single bite of food.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: And then?
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Maybe a quick shower, some toast if you're lucky, and you're out the door. That was me for FORTY YEARS. Every single morning.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: And that routine, that EXACT sequence, is creating what we call in Japan... san-aku no asa.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Which means?
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: The three morning evils.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: That sounds... dramatic.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: It IS dramatic. Because each one of those actions, jumping out of bed, coffee on an empty stomach, rushing, they compound. Your body after 60 cannot handle that stress anymore.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Okay, let me explain what's actually happening. Because when I learned this... it terrified me. After 60, your blood pressure regulation, it's not what it used to be. There's this thing called orthostatic hypotension.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: In simple terms?
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: When you stand up fast, your blood pressure DROPS. Your brain doesn't get enough oxygen for a few seconds. You might feel dizzy, lightheaded.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: And if you add coffee to that...
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: On an empty stomach, you're spiking your cortisol. Your stress hormone. Which tightens your blood vessels.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: While your blood pressure is already unstable.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Exactly. I had a patient, David, 67 years old. Active guy, played tennis three times a week. One morning, same routine he'd done for decades. Alarm, jump out of bed, coffee, shower.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: What happened?
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: He collapsed in the bathroom. Stroke. We got him to the hospital in time, but... he lost function in his left arm. Could've been prevented.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: This is why in Japan, we teach elderly people... never rush the morning. Never. Let me tell you what I do. And what my grandmother taught me when I was young.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: I'm listening.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: When I wake up, first thing, I don't move. I lie there. Eyes open. I take five slow breaths.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: You're serious? You just... lie there?
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Yes. Because I'm letting my blood pressure stabilize. My body is transitioning from sleep to wake. Then, slow movements. I wiggle my toes. Rotate my ankles. Flex my fingers. I'm waking up my circulation gradually.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Okay, then what?
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: After one minute, not before, I roll onto my side. I sit up slowly. I sit on the edge of the bed for 30 seconds.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: 30 seconds of just... sitting?
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: 30 seconds that could save your life.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Okay, but what about coffee? Because I LOVE my coffee.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: I love coffee too! But timing matters. In Japan, we have a saying. Mizu-ichi, shoku-ni, kohi-san.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Which is?
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Water first, food second, coffee third. When you wake up, you're dehydrated. Eight hours without water. So first, room temperature water. Not cold. 250 milliliters.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Then breakfast?
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Yes. Light breakfast. Even just rice with natto, or miso soup. Something gentle. THEN coffee. 60 to 90 minutes after waking.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: 60 to 90 MINUTES?!
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Yes. By then, your cortisol has naturally peaked and started to come down. Coffee won't create that dangerous spike.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: So here's the thing. After Hiroshi told me all this, I was skeptical. Really skeptical.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: But you tried it?
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: I tried it for two weeks. The slow wake-up. Water first. Waiting for my coffee. My blood pressure, I track it, it's down 12 points in the morning. TWELVE.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: And how do you feel?
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Honestly? I feel... calmer. Less jittery. And I'm not crashing at 2 PM anymore.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Because you're working WITH your body's natural rhythm, not against it.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Alright, so we've tackled the morning. But there's another habit that's even MORE dangerous.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: And most people over 60 are doing it without even thinking about it.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Medications.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Not just taking them, but HOW you're taking them. And how many.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: I have patients who come in with a bag. A literal BAG of pill bottles. 8, 10, sometimes 15 different medications.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: In Japan, we call this... kusuri-zuke. Medicine pickling.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Medicine pickling?
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Yes. Like pickling vegetables. You're preserving yourself in medications. And it's not always necessary. Here's what happens in America. You go to your cardiologist, they prescribe something for your heart. Then your endocrinologist adds something for diabetes. Your GP adds a statin. Maybe a sleep aid. Before you know it, you're on 10 pills.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: And here's the scary part. Each doctor might not know what the OTHER doctors prescribed. So nobody's looking at the WHOLE picture.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: This is called polypharmacy. And after 60, it becomes very dangerous.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: I had a patient, Susan, 71. She was on 12 medications. TWELVE. She came to me because she was exhausted all the time. Couldn't think clearly. Dizzy.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: What did you find?
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: We did a medication review. Turns out, three of her drugs were interacting with each other. One was causing her dizziness. Another was making her tired. We cut her down to 6 medications.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: And the result?
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Within two weeks... she was a different person. Energy back. Mind clear.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: In Japan, we have a different approach. We ask... can food do this job instead? Can lifestyle changes reduce the need for this medication?
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Give me an example.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: High blood pressure. In America, immediate medication. In Japan, we first try... salt reduction, walking, stress management, fermented foods like miso.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: And you know what? That approach WORKS. Studies show that lifestyle changes can be as effective as medication for mild to moderate high blood pressure.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: But Michael, there's something else about medications that Americans do wrong.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: What's that?
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: WHEN you take them. Most people take all their pills at once. Morning, with breakfast. Done.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: That's... what I tell them to do. It's easier to remember.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Easier, yes. But not optimal. Some medications work better at certain times. Some should never be taken together.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Okay, give me an example.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Calcium supplements. Very popular for bone health. If you take them with your thyroid medication... the calcium blocks the thyroid drug. You get NONE of the benefit.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: And I see this ALL the time. People don't realize.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Or statins for cholesterol. Some work better at night. Because your body produces most cholesterol while you sleep.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: So here's what I want everyone watching to do. Write down every medication you take. Not just prescriptions. Vitamins, supplements, everything.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Take that list to your doctor.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: And ask three questions. One, do I still need this? Two, is the dose still right for my age and weight? Three, what's the best time to take it?
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: And remember, more medications is not always better. Sometimes, less is more.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Alright, medication habits covered. Now let's talk about something that surprises people. Eating habits.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Specifically... skipping meals. Oh, this is a BIG one.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: I see this constantly with my patients over 60. They skip breakfast. Or they skip lunch because they're not hungry. They think... I'm eating less, that's healthy, right?
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Wrong.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: WRONG. Because after 60, your metabolism changes. Your muscle mass naturally decreases. And if you're not eating regularly... you're accelerating that muscle loss.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: In Japan, we have a principle. San-shoku. Three meals. Always. Even if small portions.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: And there's a reason for that. When you skip meals, especially at this age, your blood sugar drops. You might feel okay for a while. But then... brain fog. Fatigue. Irritability.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: And when you finally DO eat?
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: You're so hungry you overeat. Your blood sugar spikes. Then crashes. It's a roller coaster.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: And for people with diabetes or pre-diabetes, which many people over 60 have... this is VERY dangerous.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: I had a patient, Robert, 68. Type 2 diabetes. He was skipping breakfast every day. Thought he was being healthy. Fasting, you know, it's trendy.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: What happened to his blood sugar?
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: All over the place. Morning readings super high. Because when you skip breakfast, your liver dumps glucose into your blood. It thinks you're starving.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: We convinced him to eat a small breakfast. Just some eggs, vegetables, maybe rice. Within a month, his morning glucose dropped 40 points.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: 40 points! Just from eating breakfast.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Now, there is a Japanese concept that's important here. Hara hachi bu.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: I've heard this. What does it mean?
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Eat until you're 80% full. Not stuffed. Not starving. 80%.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: That's actually brilliant. Because it takes 20 minutes for your brain to register you're full. So if you eat until you FEEL full... you've actually overeaten.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Exactly. In Okinawa, where people live the longest, this is a daily practice. Three meals. Hara hachi bu. Consistent eating times.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: So the takeaway here... don't skip meals. Eat regular, balanced meals. And stop before you're completely full.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Your body will thank you. Now... let's talk about sleep. Because this is where things get REALLY interesting.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Sleep after 60 is... complicated.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Complicated is putting it mildly.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Most people think... I'm getting older, I need less sleep. That's just normal.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: That is a MYTH.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Complete myth. You need the same amount of sleep at 65 as you did at 35. Seven to eight hours. The problem is... you're not GETTING it.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: And poor sleep after 60 is linked to what?
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: EVERYTHING. Dementia. Heart disease. Depression. Diabetes. Falls.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: There was a study... from the University of California, Berkeley. They found that one night of poor sleep in elderly people can increase beta-amyloid in the brain.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Beta-amyloid. That's the protein linked to Alzheimer's.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Yes. One NIGHT. Now imagine years of poor sleep.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: So what are people doing wrong? Number one... they accept poor sleep as normal. They don't address it.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: And number two?
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Sleeping pills. Americans love sleeping pills. But those medications, especially for older adults... they increase fall risk. Cognitive impairment. Dependency.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: In Japan, we approach sleep differently. We create... rituals.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Rituals? Like what?
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Evening bath. In Japan, we call it ofuro. Not a quick shower. A proper bath. 40 degrees Celsius. 20 minutes. This raises your body temperature. Then when you get out, your temperature drops. This signals your body... time to sleep.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: That's actually backed by science. The temperature drop triggers melatonin release.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Yes. Also, we turn off screens 90 minutes before bed. No TV. No phone. We might read, but with soft light. We prepare the mind for sleep.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: And the room temperature?
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Cool. 18 to 20 degrees Celsius. Dark. Very dark. And quiet.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: I tell my patients the same thing. Your bedroom should be a cave. Cool, dark, quiet.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: There's one more thing. Daytime naps.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Oh boy, here we go. Americans feel GUILTY about napping.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: In Japan, we embrace it. We call it inemuri. It's culturally accepted. Even respected. But there's a right way and a wrong way to nap. Short naps. 20 to 30 minutes. Early afternoon. Before 3 PM. Any later, and you'll mess up your nighttime sleep.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Studies show that short naps can improve memory, reduce stress, even lower heart disease risk. But long naps, over an hour... those are linked to health problems.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: So if you need to nap... nap! But keep it short. Set an alarm.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Alright, last major habit we need to cover. And this one... people are going to be surprised.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Overexercising.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: YES. The habit of pushing yourself too hard. Now, before anyone panics... exercise is GOOD. Essential.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: But there's this mindset, especially among active seniors...
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: More is better. No pain, no gain.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: And after 60... that's DANGEROUS.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: I have patients who used to run marathons. Now they're 65, 70. And they're STILL trying to run marathons. Or they're in the gym every single day. Two hour workouts. High intensity.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: What happens to them?
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: They come to me with chronic injuries. Stress fractures. Joint pain. Exhaustion. And they feel GUILTY if they take a rest day.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: This is very different from Japan. We have a concept... ma.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: What's ma?
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Ma means... space. Pause. The gap between things. In music, it's the silence between notes. In movement, it's the rest between activities. Without ma, there is no rhythm. No balance. Just noise and chaos.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: That's... actually beautiful. And it makes sense. Your body NEEDS recovery time. Especially after 60.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: In Japan, elderly people walk. They do gentle tai chi. Gardening. Swimming. Activities that are consistent but not punishing.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: And you know what the research shows? Moderate, consistent exercise is MORE beneficial for longevity than intense, sporadic training. A study in JAMA... older adults who walked 30 minutes a day, five days a week, had LOWER mortality rates than those who did intense workouts three times a week.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Consistency over intensity.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Exactly. So if you're over 60 and you're exercising... ask yourself. Am I recovering? Do I have energy? Or am I constantly sore, exhausted, pushing through pain?
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: If you're pushing through pain... you need to embrace ma. Rest is not weakness. Rest is WISDOM.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: And here's the thing... when you rest properly, when you give your body time to recover, your workouts become MORE effective.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: This is the paradox. By doing less, you achieve more.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Alright, let's bring this all together. Because we've covered a LOT today.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: We started with mornings. The three evils. Jumping out of bed, coffee on empty stomach, rushing.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: And we gave you the Japanese solution. Slow wake-up. Water first. Wait for your coffee.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Then medications. Too many pills, wrong timing, no review with your doctor.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Solution... medication review. Ask if you still need everything. Check the timing. Consider lifestyle changes first.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Eating habits. Skipping meals, irregular eating, overeating when you finally do eat.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Japanese approach... three meals, hara hachi bu, stop at 80% full.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Sleep. Accepting poor sleep as normal, relying on pills, no bedtime routine.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Better way... evening bath, cool dark room, screens off 90 minutes before bed, short afternoon naps if needed.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: And finally, overexercising. Pushing too hard, no rest, guilt about recovery.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Embrace ma. Consistency over intensity. Rest is part of the training.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Now, if you take ONE thing from today... what should it be?
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: I would say... start with your morning. That slow wake-up routine. Because it sets the tone for your entire day.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: And it's FREE. Costs nothing. Just time. Two minutes that could save your life.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Try it tomorrow. Set your alarm five minutes earlier. When it goes off... don't jump up. Lie there. Five deep breaths. Slow movements. Sit on the edge of the bed for 30 seconds.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Then, water first. 250 milliliters. Room temperature. Before anything else.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Do that for one week. Notice how you feel. I think you'll be surprised.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: And we want to hear from you. Write in the comments. Which habit are you going to change first?
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Are you going to fix your morning routine? Review your medications? Start eating regular meals?
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Or maybe you're going to embrace ma. Give yourself permission to rest. Whatever it is, share it. Because your comment might inspire someone else.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: And if you found this helpful, please share it with someone who needs to hear this. Your parent. Your friend. Someone over 60 who's still rushing through life.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: These habits... they seem small. But over months, years... they compound. They add up. In Japan, we say... chiisana henka, ōkina kekka.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Which means?
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Small changes, big results.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: I love that. Small changes, big results. That's what we're talking about today. Not massive overhauls. Just small, sustainable changes.
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: And you know what? After doing this for two weeks myself, I can tell you... it works.
speaker: Hiroshi
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Wait, YOU did this experiment too?
speaker: Michael
title: Dangerous Habits After 60 + Japanese Longevity Secrets

text: Of course! I wanted to see how Americans adapt to Japanese habits. It works beautifully.
